did.abstract: Military dispatches of Gustavus A. Henry, commenting on troop movements and the conditions of roads in South Carolina in 1865.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Gustavus A. Henry military dispatches, 1861-1865, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Gustavus A. Henry was an assistant adjutant general with the Confederate Army of Tennessee in 1861. He later became a colonel and in February 1865, was stationed at Augusta, Georgia, where he was in the Inspector General's Office.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Military dispatches of Gustavus A. Henry, commenting on troop movements and the conditions of roads in South Carolina in 1865.
